item.title: Contact
item.description:
Please feel free to contact me using the information below.



Email: blake@blakebraun.com


LinkedIn: bbraun5

item.title: My Work
item.description:
Click to download my resume.

Through my internship experience at DISH, I was able to teach myself the fundamentals of JavaScript, React, Redux, and Radium. I thoroughly enjoy working with front-end development and have a strong interest in pursuing these languages and frameworks further. In addition, learning more about REST APIs allowed me to gain a greater understanding of web service architecture, and I hope to continue to expand this knowledge in my near future.

My YouTube channel showcases the various creative work that I have done throughout my high school and college careers.

My GitHub profile contains some samples of my coding work.

As the Vice President of Administration for the Delta Delta chapter of the Alpha Phi Omega service fraternity, I completely redesigned the chapter website, making it more visually appealing and easier to navigate.

In addition, I also maintain the Alpha Phi Omega - Delta Delta Facebook page.


As a ‘Be a Billiken Blogger’ for Saint Louis University’s Division of Marketing & Communications, I provide a current student’s perspective on undergraduate life at the University for prospective students. Click to view my personal blog for the University.

For a newswriting course, I maintain a blog related to topics in the university community as well as general tips on newswriting as a practice.

In addition, for fun, I created a Snapchat filter that is active on the campus of Saint Louis University.

item.title: About
item.description:
Click to download my resume.

As a Computer Science and Communication double major at Saint Louis University, I have a passion for both technical and creative work. I am interested in creating tools and applications that make peoples’ lives easier and more enjoyable.


I have worked in a variety of positions with duties ranging from waiting tables to compiling REST API information into a centralized React-based application. Customer service and communication experience has given me the ability to work with others and cooperate in team settings, while my technical experience ensures that I know how to get the job done.


Through my internship experience, I gained a great amount of knowledge into how corporate IT works, and how development teams work together. My project focused on helping to centralize REST API information from Swagger documentation and JSON Schemas and Examples pulled from GitLab so that developers could understand microservices without ever needing to meet their creators. I was able to teach myself JavaScript, Node.js, React/Redux, and more in order to accomplish my goals.


Through my courses, I have gained a wide variety of insight into both the information technology and communications fields. I have become proficient in Java, C/C++, Python, and more. I have also been able to practice my photography, videography, and newswriting, while strengthening other communication skills.


Personal interests and hobbies include music, photography, and more. I am a member of the Saint Louis University pep band, the Vice President of Administration for the Delta Delta chapter of the Alpha Phi Omega service fraternity, and a student blogger for Saint Louis University’s Division of Marketing and Communications, among other things. For more of my work, please see my work page.
